description.highlights: The curved wall holding the exhibition spaces and the cantilevers at either end
description.spatial design: Continuous glazed band of windows separating the curved wall, which floats above the ground
description.material design: Use of glass in the form of a continuous band of windows, and materials that allow for a floating structure
description.keywords: Bradman museum, Bowral, curved wall, cantilever, glazed windows, floating structure, cafe, St Jude Street, Glebe Park

facade.highlights: The highlight of this design is the combination of transparency and solid forms which creates an inviting and dynamic appearance.
facade.shape: The form uses a combination of angular geometry with clean lines and rectangular shapes.
facade.spatial design: The highlight of its shape and form is the way the transparent glass areas interact with the solid, darker panels, possibly metal, which provides a contrast that defines different spaces within the building.
facade.material design: The highlight in its spatial and material design is the juxtaposition of glass that allows visual permeability and the opaque vertical elements that provide solid anchoring to the structure.
facade.keywords: Transparency, Angular Geometry, Rectangular Shapes, Clean Lines, Contrast, Glass, Metal Panels, Juxtaposition, Visual Permeability, Dynamic

facade2.highlights: The building features a prominent use of glass that provides transparency and reflects the environment, creating a dialogue between the structure and its surroundings.
facade2.shape: The architecture presents a modern, boxy form with strong geometric lines and varied elevations.
facade2.spatial design: The integration of glass and solid panels in the facade highlights its shape and form, offering both open and enclosed spaces.
facade2.material design: The contrast between the transparency of the glass and the solidity of the darker metallic or composite panels gives the building a distinctive textural quality.
facade2.keywords: modern, geometric, glass, reflective, transparency, contrast, angular

interior2.highlights: The highlight of this design is the interactive and informative exhibit space, which includes visuals, texts, and artifacts presented in a dynamic and engaging way.
interior2.shape: The design uses a combination of curvilinear forms, such as the central red circular display, and rectangular shapes like the display cabinets and wall panels.
interior2.spatial design: The use of circular central display for focus and partitioned wall panels for thematic exposition creates a sense of flow and organization within the space.
interior2.material design: The materials used in this design include glass for display cases, various printed materials for the wall panels, and a mix of vibrant and darker colors to create a visually stimulating environment.
interior2.keywords: Interactive, informative, curvilinear, rectangular, flow, organized, vibrant colors, thematic exposition
